title: Friday 1AM SGT
commentary: Crypto continues to leak — BTC slides another 2% to $65,751 and ETH dips to $1,904 as the week's risk-off exodus persists, now down 5-7% for the week. US session closed ugly with 72% of issues declining in an AI/megacap rout as traders rotated hard into value and cyclicals — semis hit especially hard with SOXS bear ETF ripping 5.8%. Gold holding firm near $5,100 as the precious metals vs. crypto divergence trade extends into its second week. VIX elevated at 18.14 signals lingering jitters heading into Friday.

title: Friday Midnight SGT
commentary: Tech selloff accelerates into Friday — Nasdaq slides -0.94% and S&P 500 drops -0.42% while Dow scrapes into green at +0.03%, VIX spikes to 18.14 (+2.78%) signaling rising jitters. Precious metals cool off after the week's fireworks — gold flat at $5,098, silver retreating -1.36% to $83 as profit-taking kicks in. Crypto finds a floor with BTC +0.96% at $67.1K and ETH +0.97% near $1,948, stabilizing after the week's carnage. Oil extends losses -1.59% to $63.60 as demand concerns outweigh geopolitics; KOSPI rips +3.13% leading Asia.

title: Thursday 11PM SGT
commentary: Europe leads the global equity rally — DAX surges +1.44% and CAC +1.14% while US markets tread water with S&P 500 flat at 6,945 and Nasdaq dipping -0.27%. Crypto steadying after the week's carnage — BTC at $67.7K (+1.2%) and ETH at $1,981 (+1.3%) finding a floor. Precious metals cooling: gold -0.44% to $5,076 and silver -1.2% to $83 as the safe-haven bid fades. Oil slips -0.8% to $64.10 amid demand concerns while VIX hovers at a complacent 17.17. KOSPI outperforms Asia with a +3.13% rip; Cisco hammered -9.7% on weak guidance.

title: Thursday 10PM SGT
commentary: Crypto staging a relief rally — BTC bounces +1.5% to $68K and ETH climbs +1.7% to $1,989 after yesterday's bloodbath, though still well below last week's levels. US equities grinding higher with S&P 500 +0.43%, Nasdaq +0.51%, and Dow +0.36% as jobs data surprise refocuses attention on Fed's rate path. Precious metals cooling after the week's fireworks — gold -0.2% at $5,075, silver retreating -1.5% to $83 from $84+ highs. Oil slipping -0.6% to $64.25 as supply concerns ease. Dollar index flat at 96.80 awaiting next catalyst.

title: Thursday 5AM SGT
commentary: Precious metals domination continues — silver rockets +4.56% to $84.05, gold adds +1.57% to $5,110 as the safe-haven trade refuses to quit. Crypto bleeding accelerates with BTC sliding -2.26% to $67,299 and ETH down -2.89% to $1,955, extending the weeklong risk-off exodus from digital assets into hard commodities. US equities flatlined post-jobs — S&P 500 +0.09%, Dow -0.06%, Nasdaq -0.09% — while oil climbed +1.63% to $65 on fresh US-Iran tensions. Nikkei outperforms at +2.28% as Asia catches the global equity bid.

title: Market Close
commentary: Precious metals surge as safe-haven demand intensifies—gold rallies 1.6% to $5,111 while silver explodes 4.8% higher. Equities end mixed with the S&P 500 holding near record highs despite crypto weakness, as Bitcoin slides 1.8% to $67.5K. Crude oil firms 1.5% on tight supply concerns while the dollar index barely budges, suggesting markets are in wait-and-see mode ahead of key economic data.

title: Thursday 3AM SGT
commentary: Crypto bleeding continues — BTC sinks to $67.2K (-2.6%) and ETH tumbles to $1,943 (-3.5%) extending the risk-off unwind even as Dow defended fresh records above 50.2K. Silver's parabolic rally takes a breather at $84.03 (+4.0%) after the week's wild ride, while gold holds firm at $5,083 (+1.2%). AI chip stocks remain the market darlings — Micron, TI, Lam all +5% — as software names like Salesforce and ServiceNow hemorrhage -5% on displacement fears. Oil steady at $64.62 (+1.0%) as geopolitical bid meets demand uncertainty.

title: Thursday 2AM SGT
commentary: Silver's parabolic run extends — the white metal surges 4.8% to $84.60, now up 162% YoY as the precious metals mania accelerates despite dollar stability. Crypto remains in the penalty box with BTC at $66.5K (-4.7%) and ETH at $1,931 (-5.3%), extending this week's brutal risk-off unwind. Dow defended record highs above 50.2K on strong labor data — ADP private payrolls doubled estimates at 130K, unemployment dropped to 4.3% — while AI chip stocks ripped (Micron, TI, Lam +5% each) and software names got crushed on AI displacement fears (Salesforce, ServiceNow -5%). Oil ticked up 1.4% to $64.88 as geopolitical premium builds.

title: Thursday 1AM SGT
commentary: Crypto carnage deepens further — Bitcoin craters to $66K (-5.1%) and ETH plunges to $1,914 (-5.5%) as digital assets extend their brutal week-long selloff. Precious metals continue their divergent rally: gold breaks $5,100 (+1.4%) hitting fresh highs while silver surges 3.9% to $83.50. Oil rallies 2% to $65.20 as Iran tensions trump a huge US inventory build. US equities mixed — Dow flat at 50.2K, S&P barely green (+0.2%), Russell small caps bleeding -1% as risk rotation favors commodities over tech.

title: Thursday Midnight SGT
commentary: Crypto carnage deepens — Bitcoin plunges 3.9% to $66.5K while ETH tumbles 4.6% to $1,930, the worst session this week as digital assets extend their risk-off bleed. Silver refuses to quit, surging another 3% to $83 as precious metals continue their dollar-weakness-fueled rampage. Oil jumps 1.4% to $65 as US-Iran tensions simmer with warships massing in the Gulf. US equities flat-lining post-CPI — Dow slips below 50K (-0.40%), S&P treads water (+0.03%), Nasdaq drifts lower (-0.13%). DXY slides to 97 as dollar bears maintain control.
